item.title: Help With Code
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

O ok so do what I said.

The way RSC works is it sends these actions to the server so it works by

player.getActionSender then Teleport (X chord, Y chord)

Try something like that but the rs2 version of teleporting

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Code
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

oo umm

in rsc an npc is universal, like

it doesnt matter where the NPC is, it will automatically say the same thing.

maybe you can try something like

if npc on x chord y chord
then blah blah blah

and if npc on x chord y chord
then blah blah blah

I never tired it in rsc ill try it when I have more time tho.
It may work with RS2 though

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Code
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

No Im saying

you have this right?

[code]if (NPCID == 553) && (xcoord = 2415) && (ycoord = 2415) {
toX = 10;
toY = 10;
}[/else]

make it something like

if (NPCID == 553) && (xcoord = The X chord it passes) && (ycoord = The Y chord it passes) { toX = (where you want it Xchord); toY = (Where you want it Ychord); }[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Code
item.dc:creator: @JoshB JoshB™
item.description:
@JoshB wrote:

No i’m looking for the correct if xcoord. Because I don’t have any clue what the correct code would look like last time i’ve seen it was in a Devolution v7 source I downloaded. (Like 5 weeks ago). What the hell x then z?

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Code
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

Protip: Use the Else statement…

if x then y
else x then z

thats what your trying to do…

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Code
item.dc:creator: @JoshB JoshB™
item.description:
@JoshB wrote:

How would I make it that if I click my NPC at a certain coord it teleports but at the other it opens shop.

IE:

if (NPCID == 553) && (xcoord = 2415) && (ycoord = 2415) { toX = 10; toY = 10; }

Now obviously I know that won’t work but how would it look using the right code.

Read full topic
